definitions.definition: A tool with a heavy head and a handle used for pounding.
definitions.example: Bobby used a hammer and nails to fix the two planks together

definitions.definition: The act of using a hammer to hit something}}
definitions.example: The nail is too loose - give it a hammer.

definitions.definition: A moving part of a firearm that strikes the firing pin to discharge a gun.
The malleus, a small bone of the middle ear.
In a piano or dulcimer, a piece of wood covered in felt that strikes the string.
definitions.example: The sound the piano makes comes from the hammers striking the strings

definitions.definition: A device made of a heavy steel ball attached to a length of wire, and used for throwing.
The last stone in an end.
(frisbee) A frisbee throwing style in which the disc is held upside-down with a forehand grip and thrown above the head.
Part of a clock that strikes upon a bell to indicate the hour.
One who, or that which, smites or shatters.
definitions.example: St. Augustine was the hammer of heresies.

definitions.definition: To strike repeatedly with a hammer, some other implement, the fist, etc.
definitions.example: Tony hammered on the door to try to get him to open.

definitions.definition: To form or forge with a hammer; to shape by beating.
To emphasize a point repeatedly.
To hit particularly hard.
To ride very fast.
To strike internally, as if hit by a hammer.
definitions.example: I could hear the engine’s valves hammering once the timing rod was thrown.

definitions.definition: To defeat (a person, a team) resoundingly
To make high demands on (a system or service).
To declare (a person) a defaulter on the stock exchange.
To beat down the price of (a stock), or depress (a market).
To have hard sex with
definitions.example: Daniel hammered Mary til he came.
